attributes.action: Make it an act of treason to attempt to overturn legitimate elections/referendum
attributes.background: To attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action subverts the nation's democratic nature.
attributes.additional_details: It is an act of treason to aid the enemy: to attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action runs counter to the nation's democratic nature.

attributes.action: Brexit talks by committee of 65, on the basis of proportional representation.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has now voted to leave the EU, to ensure that the negotiations are carried out with every person from every political background being represented I propose a committee carry out the talks based on a Proportional Representation distribution of seats from the last General election.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the biggest political event in our life times, no one party should be tarred with the negotiations of extracting the United Kingdom from the EU.
All parts of society need to feel 'United' in a common goal and see first hand that their voice is being heard.
The Scottish, Welsh, Irish, Labour, Conservatives, Lib dems, Greens, Ukip all represent the United Kingdom.... Let us Unite for the common good where no one is left behind unheard.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.

attributes.action: To rule out membership of the E.E.A
attributes.background: Following the vote on the U.K.'s membership of the E.U. there is much discussion about the way forward. One option is membership of the E.E.A. given the express desire of the public, in voting to leave, is to establish sovereignty and control of our boarders this option is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Start a fund to help EU nationals obtain their permanent residence cards
attributes.background: This petition asks that the government considers starting a fund to help all EU nationals that wish to become British citizens pay for their permanent residence cards and associated lawyerâ€™s fees, allowing them to further integrate with the UK before it leaves the EU.
attributes.additional_details: EU nationals that have migrated to the UK have a net positive contribution to the UK economy. These EU nationals now face having to obtain a permanent residence card to remain in the UK or obtain British citizenship, a requirement to vote on decisions affecting their future. Before November 12th 2015 there was no requirement for citizens of EU countries to obtain a permanent residence card. There is no guarantee that EU and EEA citizens will be able to remain without one. http://bit.ly/1RJEOMm

attributes.action:
New Bank Holiday.
The Epiphany should be a national bank holiday.
attributes.background: I always have to work the Epiphany and I feel that this is not correct. Whilst other cultures are allowed extra time off work to celebrate their beliefs, myself and many others are denied this opportunity. If it was a Bank Holiday, everybody could unite, join in and celebrate this event.
attributes.additional_details:
Epiphany is a public holiday in countries such as Austria, Colombia, Croatia, Cyprus, Poland, Ethiopia (but on different date that varies annually), parts of Germany, Greece, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, and Uruguay. 

http://www.timeanddate.com/holidays/common/epiphany

attributes.action: implement a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing (fracking) for 20 years
attributes.background: fracking is still in the early stages of development compared with other mining methods but seems to already be implicated in various environmental problems, a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing for a minimum of 20 years will give time to show the long term implications for the environment

attributes.action: Discuss the establishment of a rival EU 'London based Global trading group'.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom's decision to leave the EU has created an ideal opportunity to create a separate trading group outside of and free of the influences of the EU. Based in London, the new trading group will operate in a new purpose built center, whose sole focus will be economy and trade.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's decision to leave the EU is a fantastic chance to create a truly global trading group. With the UK's strong links to her commonwealth countries(both former and present), the United States, China and Japan, the establishment of a new economic trading group based in London in new, purpose headquarters will undoubtedly attract existing members of the EU who are reluctant to leave. The strengths of the new Pan trading group, is the absence of politics and its location in a truly global city.

attributes.action: In an Indy ref 2, Scottish Regions that vote to remain in the uk should remain.
attributes.background: The SNP government have consistently said that it supports the will of the Scottish people - if that's so then they must support a region by region vote allowing those regions who wish to remain in the uk to do so.
attributes.additional_details: After the eu referendum regional parties jumped on the bandwagon by turning a uk vote in to a countries vote all to further their own agendas. That's fine however if regions within those countries want to remain in the uk they should not be denied their democratic right to do so.

attributes.action: Ban the use of in game purchases for non-permanent downloads
attributes.background: The gaming industry is slowly being ruined by games that are paid, yet have objectives or objectives that are almost inachievable without paying more. We therefore call for legislation to ban these purchases for this virtual cash. By this we do not mean paid permanent addons or expansions.
attributes.additional_details: For example: You buy a game. You spend Â£40. Then you start playing and you pretty much get forced or pressured to buy 'virtual cash' to get certain things in the game that is free dlc but so overpriced in the games' currency that achievement of this is only possible through either excessive play to near extremes or take the easy route and pay your hard earned cash to 'quick buy' this. Not only is this discrimination to those who have less money but its ruining games and must therefore be banned.

attributes.action: Make it so petition makers can represent their issue and argument in parliament.
attributes.background: Are you tired of an issue being raised through a petition, only for it to be raised in parliament and the issue not solved. I feel that we should have a chance to voice our issues and make our argument heard, not only through writing, but as people and actually get a resolution to the problem.

attributes.action: Following EU exit vote make UK tax haven to maintain/entice economic investment.
attributes.background: There is a strong potential that foreign investment will be negatively impacted following the EU exit vote, with markets & currencies already slumping. I am suggesting the UK becomes a tax haven (with subsequent tax reform) to assist in maintaining & promoting foreign investment & economic growth.

attributes.action: Make the drink driving law more strict or introduce a zero tolerance policy.
attributes.background:
Every year, over 250 people are killed on UK roads and over 7,000 casualties from drink driving. In 2013, 683,651 roadside breath tests were carried out by the police, which 71,675 drivers
or riders failed or refused to take the test. Many of these are due to people driving the morning after.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned suggest that people refer to the horrific facts shown in the RoSPA July 2015 "Drinking and Driving" report to see that even just 1 accident, injury or even death is too many. A reform of the law should be considered to lower the limit or introduce a zero tolerance on the matter. Thus to save the lives of countless people horrifically torn away from their families in such awful circumstances.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to show a Nazi-style swastika tattoo.
attributes.background: Sporting a Nazi swastika tattoo is as much a hate crime as speaking such sentiments. They should be made illegal if they are visible and tattoo parlours should be punished under the law by fines and prison sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
Swastikas are illegal in Germany and should be illegal in the UK too.
Let us not forget the hundreds of thousands of people who lost their lives fighting Nazism in the last world war and people who think they are somehow being patriotic by having these symbols of hatred engraved in their skin are actually just spitting on their graves.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for neighbours to record you & your property with CCTV!
attributes.background:
Currently, there are no laws governing the use of domestic CCTV  which impacts the neighbouring resident's privacy. Neighbours are able to record you, your family & your property. LEGALLY

Your privacy can be taken away from you & placed in the hands of your neighbours! PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY!
attributes.additional_details:
My neighbour has recently installed CCTV which captures the whole of my garden. He now has 24/7 access to my whole garden and is able to sit and watch us from his smart phone whenever he wishes! 

We have asked him to move the cameras as we have children and would prefer that they are not recorded! He has refused and there is nothing we can about it but to create this petition in hopes that you will sign to help bring back our privacy. 

We need to protect ourselves and our families! PLEASE SIGN

attributes.action: To let 13-17 year olds vote.
attributes.background: I think after the European referendum, people have now realisd the real consequence of the outcome but what people don't understand is that it will affect our children's futures. They should have the right to vote to protect their futures and decide what is right.

attributes.action: Parliament should defer their recess until Article 50 is instigated.
attributes.background: In the light of the major decisions facing this country and pressures from EU Members, require that Parliament defer their recess until the negotiations with the EU over the referendum result, MPs vote on accepting referendum and instigation of Article 50

attributes.action: Britain should apply to become the 51st state of the United States of America
attributes.background: In light of the result of the EU Referendum held on Thursday 23 June and the immediate concomitant decline in the UK economy, it would be germain to enter into a stronger economic union with the United States of America at the earliest possible opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: Under Article IV, Section 3, of the US Constitution, any territory may apply to Congress to join the United States. As the 51st US state, Great Britain would gain all the economic and military backing of the US federal government whilst also being free to draft its own state constitution and effectively retain its sovereignty. This would have the added advantage of allowing the UK Government to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty sooner than October in order to re-stabilise the EU economy.

attributes.action: have a general election and a  referendum on the eu membership
attributes.background: as i don't believe people had the full facts of what they were doing and what would happen as the truth was not told

attributes.action: Make a hotel for refugees
attributes.background: It's so important to help with the refugee crisis that I decided to help, I want to help turn an old field or old building into a nice beautiful hotel for refugees coming from poor war torn countries.

attributes.action: Start talks on exiting the EU NOW
attributes.background:
The people have spoken and voted to leave the EU, David Cameron decided to quit, leaving nobody in charge. Labour MPs quitting, other MPs bickering and not listening to the people.
It's simple: we need to start the process to leave the EU NOW, not several months/years after this pointless nagging

attributes.action: Spend Â£250 million on our Healthcare
attributes.background: After the destructive Brexit our economy and currency have fallen and the promises made for our healthcare have been broken and now we need to spend Â£250 million pounds right!
attributes.additional_details: We hope this raises national attention as we want a better Britain and through this money being spend properly we can start straight away.

attributes.action: Allow smoke bombs/pyrotechnics at football matches.
attributes.background: It will improve the atmosphere at the games.

attributes.action: British Overseas Territories must be allowed to negotiate with the EU directly
attributes.background: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. There was no opportunity for Territories to vote in the referendum and the decision by the UK will impact them.
attributes.additional_details: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. Following the UK vote to leave the EU, all Overseas Territories, who had no opportunity to vote, require the ability to negotiate with the EU without restriction from the UK.

attributes.action: Future referendums to be subject to a 40% of eligible voters threshold.
attributes.background: A petition to require that all future referendums which would trigger constitutional change should be subject to both an absolute majority of those voting AND a 40% of eligible voters threshold.

attributes.action: Block the ability to share government petitions on Facebook.
attributes.background: We are seeing an increase in the number of petitions created and shared on social media. These petitions have become slightly annoying and we this British people urge for these to be distributed by private messaging only.

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Make Government & Politics an optional GCSE subject
attributes.background: Government & Politics is currently not an existing GCSE qualification, with increased voter apathy in particular amongst young people, giving them the tools to engage in the political process, should they wish, from an earlier age than currently exists may increase political participation.
attributes.additional_details: In the EU Referendum (2016) voter turnout amongst 18-24 year olds was 36% (@SkyData), however the turnout for the referendum as a whole was 72% showing voter apathy to be particular prevalent amongst the young.

attributes.action: Trigger Article 50 and then immediately hold a general Election
attributes.background: Votes have been cast, now we demand the government deliver change. No politicians have a mandate to take this forward.

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell cot bumper which can cause suffocation to babies.
attributes.background: The safety of cot bumpers is questionable because of the risk of suffocation and/or strangulation. They can also be used to climb on when your baby becomes more mobile so they're not recommended yet they still sold in stores to unaware parents.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/11/151124081508.htm

attributes.action: Not allow people over 60 to vote in referendums or other elections.
attributes.background: Many elections including the EU referendum will mainly affect people who are currently working. Only people between 18-60 should be able to vote as the outcome is going to only affect them especially people aged 18-30 as it is there future which could be at stake.
attributes.additional_details: In the recent EU referendum, according to YouGov, 75% of people aged 18-25 voted to remain apart of the EU. It's their future which is going to affected by older people who may not still be around for the outcome of the referendum.

attributes.action: Scotland should hold a second independence referendum within 6 months.
attributes.background: The Scottish people should be given an opportunity to choose between remaining in the EU or the United Kingdom. From England's perspective this issue needs resolving quickly so that negotiations with the EU can proceed without uncertainty over Scotland's position.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's on road,6pm Friday to 6am Monday,June to August,for holiday traffic.
attributes.background: This proposal would considerably ease congestion in the holiday season,and has been shown to work in Sweden.Goods deliveries can be scheduled during the rest of the week with minimal disruption .

attributes.action: Rename the 'House of Lords' to give it a gender neutral title.
attributes.background: The House of Lords immortalises the idea that it is men who rule the country. In order to take a significant step towards an otherwise overlooked deficiency in political equality, we should retitle the House of Lords so as to retain gender neutrality - for instance, to the House of Peers.

attributes.action: let Australian and other Commonwealth countries practice Nursing in the UK
attributes.background: Let countries such as Australia be able to come to the UK and practice Nursing unlike the current law of only letting EU nurses practice with out having to re-training

attributes.action: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK
attributes.background: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK, regardless of nationality.

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over Â£1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Ensure sovereignty cannot be transferred from parliament without a referendum.
attributes.background: When we leave the EU the power to make and enforce laws will be returned to the UK parliament and courts.  We need legislation to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The power of the UK parliament and courts to make and enforce legislation has been gradually eroded over 40 years of EU membership.  Now that we are at last getting these powers back we need legislation affirming that sovereignty, that is to say the power to make and enforce our own laws, belongs to the people and to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without the consent of the people through a referendum.

attributes.action: Hold another EU referendum for voters aged 16 to 35
attributes.background: As we are the future let us have a say in our future

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: Cut down University fees to Â£6,000
attributes.background: Kids/teenagers in this generation want to do well for the future and to do that they need to go University. But how will they go University if the University fee's are higher than they used to be? What if the fees go higher?

attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: EU referendum voting
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the remain or leave vote is more than 50.1% based and a turnout of more than  55% there should not be another referendum.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Hold an early General Election when Brexit terms have been agreed.
attributes.background: Now that Britain has decided to leave, but on terms not yet agreed, it is only right that whatever the terms end up being that they are put to the people at a General Election to get a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Make anyone over the age of 50 unable to vote in a Second EU Election
attributes.background:
Recently the Elderly Population of this Country has been able to Dictate over the Young Generation of this great nation.
Lets make sure that the People that are going to be affected by Brexit and other elections the most decide.
Also to make the system equal, by lowering the minimum age to 15.

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.
